main event: On March 19, 1955, a reddish, 'V' formation almost transparent object with a dark center was observed for 10 seconds in Farmingdale, Long Island. It was described as having no sound and almost transparent.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 10 seconds, indicating a brief and sudden appearance of the unidentified object.
The object was described as having a 'V' formation and being almost transparent, with a reddish color and dark center.
The official assessment listed possibilities ranging from balloon, aircraft, to astronomical, and concluded with 'Unknown'.
This report was considered accurate and factual by the authorities, adding credibility to the sighting.
The sighting was communicated via air mail telegram and phone calls between different traffic and flight control centers.
sighted object: Reddish, 'V' formation almost transparent object with a dark center
witnesses: Traffic center, Andrews, DC, PATCUS, Air and Move Control, Army Flight Information Service, Flight Director, Farmingdale, NY
